Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_mem_alloc_lock

The function AIL_mem_alloc_lock allocates a locked block of memory.

void * AIL_mem_alloc_lock(
  U32 size
);

In Parameters

size
specifies the size of the block of memory that you need.

Returns

The pointer to the new block of memory, or NULL if the allocation failed.

Discussion

Under standard Win32 platforms (Windows 9x, Windows NT), you don't have to use this function - you can just use normal memory.

Under Win16 and Win32s, you must use this function for all sample and sequence pointers passed into MSS.

Under DOS, you should use this function, or the AIL_vmm_lock functions, to ensure that the memory is available at interrupt time.

Under Win16, special precautions are taken to prevent memory in the lower 1 MB range from being consumed.

Under DOS, MacOS and Win16, this function must not be invoked from an interrupt-based callback function.

Example files that use this function: DEMO.C
